file_content.text: Backup! We need backup!
Temporary crew quarters are just outside the hangar doors, Lieutenant. Go and find yourself a bunk before all the good ones are taken.
Good day, Lieutenant. Welcome aboard the Justice. Need to run a few questions by you before you head on into the crew area.
Go right ahead, Lieutenant.
Sure thing.
What kind of questions?
Questions?
Nothing major--just a couple of quick questions to help with the personnel tracking.
I don't have time for your stupid questions, all right?
Bother someone else.
So make time. Tavus says ask everyone, so I'm asking everyone. Take it up with him--after we're done.
Which planet were you posted on, Lieutenant? Who did you serve with?
I was posted on that wrecked, swamp hole Taris. Needles was in charge.
Needles, on Taris.
Taris? I heard some bad stuff went down on Taris.
So, uh, so tell me... did Needles really test that bioweapon on his own people? Turn them into monsters?
Needles was completely insane.
That's affirmative.
Totally unbelievable. Sounds like you were lucky to get out alive.
They were all ten meters tall and breathing fire by the end.
Horrible monsters!
You've got to be kidding me! Needles must have been pretty cracked.
You shouldn't believe everything you hear, Lieutenant.
That's ridiculous.
No--but the guys I talked to... something must have really gotten to them out there.
I was stuck bowing to noblemen on Alderaan. Gearbox was running the show.
Gearbox, on Alderaan.
Oh yeah? Some of the other guys were telling me Gearbox put together his own assault walker--really advanced stuff. Is it true?
I saw the thing with my own eyes, Lieutenant.
One hundred percent true.
I'll bet it was pretty impressive. Too bad the prototype couldn't be salvaged, huh? Wouldn't mind riding into battle on one of those babies!
That thing was a hunk of junk.
It was worthless.
Really? That's not what the other guys were saying. Guess they were just easily impressed.
You really think that old man could build a battle walker?
You're joking, right?
Come on--Gearbox wasn't really old. And he was pretty brilliant. So yeah, I'd buy it.
I was stationed on some rock called Tatooine. With Fuse.
Fuse, on Tatooine.
Fuse, huh? Some other guys from Tatooine were telling me he cracked out there--that he suddenly just refused to continue his work.
Fuse totally lost it. He even locked himself in a closet.
That's right, Lieutenant.
Wow. Guess it's never the ones you expect, huh? I mean, he was in Havoc Squad--you'd think he could keep it together.
Fuse didn't crack, he just refused to butcher civilians.
He had morals.
Hey, you ask me, you're better off dead than living on that rock.
I never even saw Fuse. I don't know what happened.
I wouldn't know.
So what about this other rumor I keep hearing? That a single Republic soldier came in and broke up the entire operation? Is that really true?
The guy was a killing machine--I still have nightmares.
It's true, Lieutenant.
A real one-woman army--and she didn't take prisoners.
It's true, Lieutenant.
Sounds pretty serious. But hey, you made it--we're in the clear, now.
The soldier who took us out wasn't alone--there were two of them.
It wasn't just one soldier.
Still, though--two soldiers just show up and take entire operations apart? Whoever they are, I hope I never run into them.
I never thought one soldier could do so much damage.
It was incredible.
Me either. Guess we'd all better stay on our toes, huh?
Hey, I won't hold you up any longer, Lieutenant. Go on and head for the crew area. I'll bet you could use some rest after what you've been through.
See you around.
Yeah--that was me.
What? Intruders! We've got intruders! Sound the alarm, put all sections on alert!
Welcome aboard, sir.
I'm not sure that uniform is regulation, soldier.
